main event: A pilot and observers reported seeing 10 to 15 unidentified disk-shaped objects over Lake Demp, Virginia on April 7, 1954.
interesting points: The objects were pale green in color and estimated to be 35 to 40 feet in size.,The objects were observed at an altitude of approximately 3500 feet.,They were moving in a southwesterly direction at about 600 to 800 knots.,The sighting lasted for approximately 3 to 5 minutes.,The witnesses believed the objects were not of this world and did not resemble any known aircraft.
witness description: Pilot and observers engaged in flying an air mission
